definition: to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: Feel the body relax, feel the tenseness disappear, but do not fall asleep.
sentences.chinese: 感觉身体放松，感觉绷紧消失，但是不要睡着。

sentences.english: Spin me around til I fell asleep.
sentences.chinese: 抱着我旋转直到我睡着。

sentences.english: The mother laid the sleeping boy against her.
sentences.chinese: 母亲让睡着的男孩紧靠着她。

sentences.english: Expensive into mom to take care of small into also very tired, she fell asleep sitting there.
sentences.chinese: 贵成妈为照顾小成也很累，她坐在那里就睡着了。

sentences.english: She was found asleep on a pillow of leaves.
sentences.chinese: 有人看见她枕着树叶睡着了。

sentences.english: I'm not in the scene , I think I'm fallin' asleep.
sentences.chinese: 我不在场景中，我认为我睡着了。

sentences.english: If the person next to you is asleep, gently wake him or her up.
sentences.chinese: 如果你身边的人睡着了，轻轻地把他或她唤醒。

sentences.english: I was so relaxed by my day at the beach, that I fell asleep in the sun.
sentences.chinese: 在阳光普照的海滩上，我放松得睡着了。

sentences.english: I was so tired that I fell asleep.
She reads the old man to sleep every evening.
sentences.chinese: 她每天晚上读书使老人听着听着就睡着了。

sentences.english: The child had laid her head on a stone and fallen asleep.
sentences.chinese: 孩子早已把头枕在一块石头上睡着了。

sentences.english: Somebody who lives by himself goes to sleep.
sentences.chinese: 某个独居的人晚上睡着了。

sentences.english: The dog curled up on the floor and went to sleep .
sentences.chinese: 这条狗蜷伏在地板上，睡着了。

sentences.english: And immediately he fell asleep, tired in body, but with a tranquil soul.
sentences.chinese: 他体倦心安，立刻睡着了。

sentences.english: The entire palace fell asleep, along with the Princess.
sentences.chinese: 整个宫殿都和公主一起睡着了。

sentences.english: The wind had blown her down while she was asleep.
sentences.chinese: 在她睡着的时候风已经把她给吹了下来。

definition: to awaken/to wake sb up/to rouse
to sleep soundly/to fall into a deep sleep
